meanings.definition: A soft, sticky substance in the mouth
meanings.sent1: After eating the candy, there was some gummas stuck to my teeth.
meanings.sent2: The dentist advised brushing teeth to remove any gummas left behind.
meanings.sent3: The gummas from the bubblegum made funny shapes when blown into balloons.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like gummas, spreading joy and sweetness around.
meanings.sent5: The gummas on the lollipop sparkled in the sunlight, tempting me to take a bite.

meanings.definition: A swelling or growth on the skin or internal organs, typically caused by syphilis
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with syphilis after finding gummas on the skin.
meanings.sent2: The gummas on his arm were a clear sign of the disease's progression.
meanings.sent3: The tiny gummas on the model of the human body looked like little bumps on a map.
meanings.sent4: The city's pollution problem was like gummas slowly spreading through its streets.
meanings.sent5: The dark shadow of the gummas haunted the character, a reminder of past mistakes.
